task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 158°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline and base in frame to estimate its full height, so I’ll tilt the camera up while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointing north and up, so I must rotate to face south (~158–180°) to bring the target building back into view for a height estimate.
I’m facing south but need the full facade including roofline, so I’ll tilt up to capture the building’s top for a height estimate.
The heading has flipped back to north again, so I must rotate to south (180°) to re-acquire the building before estimating its height.
To estimate height I need to see both the base and roofline together, so I’ll keep facing south and tilt slightly up rather than losing the ground reference.
The view keeps snapping to north after pitching, so I’ll rotate back to south (180°) and then I can estimate from the building facade.
I have enough alignment facing south and can now provide a reasonable height estimate for the main building based on typical mid-rise floor heights and visible stories.
